substances.name: Ayahuasca
substances.description: Psychoactive brew traditionally used for therapeutic and ritual purposes by indigenous groups in Northwestern Amazonian countries

components.function: blocks MAO enzyme in gut, permits DMT absorption

activeCompounds.name: harmaline
activeCompounds.note: Higher concentrations associated with stronger, more challenging effects

contexts: religious contexts (Santo Daime, União do Vegetal)

ceremonial_therapeutic.context: Most research focuses on single or occasional high doses

dosing.notes: Dosing is highly variable and difficult to standardize due to traditional preparation methods

absorption.mechanism: MAOIs from B. caapi prevent DMT degradation in gut, allowing absorption

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: DMT metabolized by MAO enzymes; harmala alkaloids inhibit this process

toleranceDevelopment.note: Traditional use patterns typically involve infrequent dosing

substances.physiologicalDependence: none reported in traditional use contexts
substances.psychologicalDependence: rare, though some users report cravings

riskFactors.name: MAOI Drug and Food Interactions
riskFactors.description: The harmala alkaloids in ayahuasca act as MAOIs, creating dangerous interactions with various substances and foods
riskFactors.mechanism: MAO inhibition prevents breakdown of tyramine and serotonin, leading to accumulation

specificInteractions.mechanism: Tyramine buildup causes dangerous blood pressure elevation

preventionStrategies: Dietary restrictions 24-48 hours before and after

riskFactors.name: Non-Traditional Preparation and Supervision
riskFactors.description: Using ayahuasca in non-supervised and non-traditional contexts significantly increases risk

riskFactors.name: Increased Lifetime Use
riskFactors.description: Increased lifetime ayahuasca use positively related to higher risk of adverse effects

riskFactors.name: Older Age at First Use
riskFactors.description: First ayahuasca use at an older age increases risk of adverse effects

riskFactors.name: Female Sex
riskFactors.description: Being female increases risk of certain adverse effects

riskFactors.name: Pre-existing Physical Health Conditions
riskFactors.description: Having physical health conditions increases risk of adverse effects

riskFactors.name: History of Substance Use Disorder
riskFactors.description: History of substance use disorder increases risk of adverse physical effects

riskFactors.name: Intensity of Acute Spiritual Experience
riskFactors.description: Stronger acute spiritual experiences positively associated with adverse effects
riskFactors.nuance: May reflect intensity of overall experience rather than spiritual content per se

riskFactors.name: Deviations from Traditional Preparation
riskFactors.description: Improper brewing techniques alter chemical composition and increase risk

medicalConditions.name: Psychotic Disorders (Ayahuasca-Specific)
medicalConditions.description: Personal or family history of schizophrenia, schizophreniform disorders, or psychotic depression

substanceRisks.mechanism: Transient increases in blood pressure and heart rate

animalStudies.findings: abortifacient and teratogenic effects at higher doses

adverseEvents.name: Vomiting and Nausea
adverseEvents.description: Most common physical effect of ayahuasca

prevalenceData.context: participants reporting acute physical health adverse effects

culturalContext.traditional_interpretation: Viewed as positive purging and cleansing effect
culturalContext.therapeutic_significance: Often considered part of the healing process

drugInteractions.impaired_absorption: Vomiting and diarrhea can impair absorption of other oral medications

adverseEvents.name: Cardiovascular Effects
adverseEvents.description: Transient increases in blood pressure and heart rate
adverseEvents.clinicalSignificance: Generally well-tolerated in healthy individuals; concerning for those with cardiovascular conditions

adverseEvents.name: Acute Anxiety and Psychological Distress
adverseEvents.description: Anxiety, transient paranoia, confusion, despair, and psychological distress during ayahuasca experience

culturalContext.traditional_interpretation: Sometimes perceived as part of therapeutic process
culturalContext.variable_severity: Can range from manageable discomfort to intense distress

adverseEvents.name: Visual and Auditory Distortions
adverseEvents.description: Altered perception of visual and auditory stimuli

culturalContext.traditional_interpretation: Often interpreted positively within ceremonial context
culturalContext.therapeutic_value: May provide insights or facilitate healing process

adverseEvents.name: Challenging Experiences
adverseEvents.description: Intensely distressing psychological experiences during ayahuasca session
characteristics: Sense of dying or losing control

culturalContext.traditional_interpretation: Often perceived as part of therapeutic process
culturalContext.nuance: Can be intensely distressing despite potential therapeutic value

adverseEvents.name: Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder (HPPD)
adverseEvents.description: Persistent perceptual disturbances after ayahuasca use

adverseEvents.name: Persistent Adverse Effects
adverseEvents.description: Ongoing adverse effects requiring professional support

adverseEvents.name: Subjective Cognitive Changes
adverseEvents.description: Changes in thinking style and cognitive functioning

findings.objective_testing: No evidence of long-term cognitive impairment
findings.memory: Some studies suggest improved memory and preserved global cognitive function

adverseEvents.name: Seizures
adverseEvents.description: Convulsive episodes during or after ayahuasca use

adverseEvents.name: Sexual Trauma Re-experiencing
adverseEvents.description: Re-experiencing of past sexual assault during ayahuasca ceremonies

adverseEvents.name: Hypertensive Crisis
adverseEvents.description: Dangerous elevation in blood pressure due to MAOI-tyramine interaction
adverseEvents.mechanism: Consumption of tyramine-rich foods while MAOIs present in system
prevention: Strict dietary restrictions before and after ayahuasca

adverseEvents.name: Serotonin Syndrome
adverseEvents.description: Life-threatening condition from excessive serotonin due to MAOI-serotonergic drug interaction
adverseEvents.mechanism: Combination of ayahuasca MAOIs with serotonergic medications

therapeuticAlliance.name: Shaman/Facilitator Relationship
therapeuticAlliance.description: Quality of relationship with traditional shaman or ceremony facilitator

traditionalContext.role: Experienced indigenous healers guide ceremony and provide support
traditionalContext.training: Years of apprenticeship and traditional knowledge

modernContext.variability: Wide variation in training, experience, and ethical standards

components.importance: Essential for feeling safe during vulnerable experience
Understanding traditional practices and their meaning
Ability to handle challenging experiences and emergencies

boundaryViolations.name: Sexual Misconduct in Ayahuasca Ceremonies
boundaryViolations.description: Sexual misconduct by facilitators, shamans, or other participants

prevalenceData.finding: 46.3% of sexual misconduct perpetrators were underground sitters/guides

specificRisks: Lack of oversight in unregulated settings
Cultural contexts that may normalize inappropriate touch

boundaryViolations.name: Cultural Appropriation and Exploitation
boundaryViolations.description: Appropriation of indigenous practices without respect or benefit to source communities

preparationPractices.name: Dietary Restrictions (Dieta)
preparationPractices.description: Avoiding tyramine-rich foods and other substances to prevent dangerous interactions with MAOIs

items: Soy sauce and other fermented soy products
restrictions.reason: High tyramine content can cause hypertensive crisis

preparationPractices.name: Traditional Ceremonial Preparation
preparationPractices.description: Traditional preparation practices to ready body, mind, and spirit

integrationPractices.name: Somatic Integration (Ayahuasca-Specific)
integrationPractices.specialRelevance: Especially important for processing the intense physical component of ayahuasca

integrationPractices.name: Community Integration Support
integrationPractices.description: Integration support within ayahuasca community or integration circles

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Botanical Misidentification
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Incorrect identification of plant species used in ayahuasca preparation

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Improper Brewing Techniques
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Deviations from traditional preparation methods affecting chemical composition

specificIssues.consequence: Incomplete extraction or excessive harmaline concentration
Variable potency, increased risk of adverse effects
Loss of safety features built into traditional methods

contaminationQualityFactors.highRiskPreparations: Higher concentrations of harmaline associated with stronger and potentially more challenging effects

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Adulteration with Other Substances
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Addition of substances not traditionally part of ayahuasca

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Environmental Contamination
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Contamination during harvesting, storage, or preparation

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Potency Variability
harmReduction: Starting with conservative doses in new contexts

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Non-Pharmacological Interventions for Ayahuasca
ayahuascaSpecificConsiderations: Extended duration compared to other psychedelics
Traditional healing practices may be appropriate

interventions.description: Icaros (healing songs), tobacco smoke, spiritual protection
interventions.appropriateness: In traditional contexts with experienced shaman

interventions.description: Support during purging, cleaning, fresh air
Remind experience is temporary, medicine-related, safe
interventions.culturalAdaptation: Frame within traditional understanding if appropriate

specificEmergencies.treatment: Discontinue all serotonergic agents, supportive care, possible ICU

specificEmergencies.response: Hydration support, possible IV fluids if severe
Protect from injury, time seizure, call EMS if prolonged or repeated

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Indigenous Traditional Context
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Traditional indigenous use of ayahuasca in healing and spiritual ceremonies

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Western Adoption and Medicalization
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Adoption of ayahuasca in Western medical and therapeutic contexts
considerations: How to honor traditional knowledge while adapting to new contexts

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Ayahuasca Tourism
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Commercial ayahuasca retreat industry, particularly in Peru

impacts.reported_issues: Negative economic, social, cultural, health, and environmental impacts in Peru

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Syncretic Religious Movements
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Religious movements incorporating ayahuasca (Santo Daime, União do Vegetal)
characteristics: Blend of indigenous, Christian, and other traditions
considerations: Different risk profile than unregulated use

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Legal Status of Ayahuasca
legalSocioeconomicFactors.complexity: High - DMT is controlled but traditional ayahuasca use has exemptions in some places

statusByRegion.status: DMT Schedule I; limited religious exemptions
statusByRegion.context: Santo Daime and UDV have specific exemptions

impacts: Limits access to safer, regulated contexts

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Socioeconomic Access Barriers
legalSocioeconomicFactors.description: Financial and resource barriers to safe ayahuasca use

barriers.impact: Only wealthy can access legitimate retreat settings

barriers.description: Many retreats require international travel to Peru, Brazil, or other locations

barriers.impact: Those with inflexible jobs cannot participate

barriers.description: Safe, legitimate access concentrated in certain regions
barriers.impact: Rural and underserved populations lack access

consequences: Wealthy access safe contexts; poor relegated to unregulated use
Higher risk of unsafe use in lower SES populations

mechanism: MAOIs in ayahuasca prevent serotonin breakdown
Combined effect causes dangerous serotonin accumulation

prevention: Strict dietary restrictions 24-48 hours before and after

complexInteractions.prevalence: High among women with sexual assault history

complexInteractions.specificOutcome: Increased physical and neurological adverse effects
recommendations: Enhanced medical screening for older first-time users
Starting with lower doses if possible

metadata.documentSource: Ayahuasca Literature Review - Psychedelic Safety Institute
metadata.geographicScope: Global with emphasis on South America (origin), North America and Europe (contemporary use)
metadata.qualityAssessment: Comprehensive but limited by small sample sizes and lack of long-term studies
knownLimitations: Most studies involve relatively small sample sizes
Most research focuses on single or occasional high-dose use
Traditional contexts underrepresented in formal research
uniqueConsiderations: Complex botanical preparation with multiple active compounds
MAOI component creates unique drug/food interaction risks
Strong cultural and spiritual context critical to understanding
Traditional indigenous knowledge essential but at risk of appropriation
Environmental sustainability concerns with increased demand
Significant physical component (purging) integral to experience
Extended duration compared to synthetic psychedelics
Tourism industry creates unique risks and ethical concerns
criticalSafetyNotes: MAOI interactions with tyramine-rich foods can be fatal
Serotonin syndrome risk with serotonergic medications is critical
Medication washout periods must be observed
Traditional preparation methods have built-in safety features
Female participants have specific vulnerability (sexual trauma re-experiencing)
Quality control highly variable in unregulated settings
